intro: Donax thouarii, commonly known as the Madagascar senna, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are adapted for dispersal by wind or animals. Donax thouarii plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
